reviews.sentence: Loved the location. The location A fabulous spot. Jack London Square is lovely. The kids had a great time on the ferry across to Pier 39 close to Fishermans Wharf and Alcatraz Pier. Plenty of varied eating in Jack London nice restruants but as a family we chose Plank which is like a beer garden and had great service and food. The hotel room Very nice place to stay and we appreciated the extra room family of 4. We were given a disabled suite which had 2 tvs and a seperate lounge area. fabulous as we have been travelling for 4 weeks. The service was friendly room was quiet clean and well appointed. Valet Parking. This was my negative. For two nights we paid more than 500 and then got slugged an extra 50 for parking. When I booked there was no mention of valet parking. it was parking available. Not happy about this especially considering our car was moved 20 metres and there it stayed until we checked out. Sorry but this left a bad taste in what was supposed to be the highlight acomodation of our trip. We did not encounter this even in Las Vegas at the Hilton free undercover parking. Nice place great location. but needs to be upfront about unavoidable parking cost.

Nice hotel but not worth the cost. The hotel staff was very pleasant and the room was very spacious. Its located in the heart of Jack London Square so there are plenty of restaurant choices and places to walk. BUT it is right where the train stops. We heard the train and the whistle blowing every 20 minutes or thereabouts up until 10pm then started up again at around 50 AM. The earplugs they supply for you does not block out the noise of the train nor the loud humming noise in the room 247. There was also the very loud noise coming from the air unit on top of all the other noises such as other guests were having some sort of party and there was pounding and loud tvs. Bottom line did not get a whole lot of sleep. For the price we paid I also expected a better view at least not one that overlooks the parking lot. There was not a mini refrigerator or microwave in our room even though they say they are standard in every room. I still rate it an overall 3 star because of the staff cleanliness spaciousness and location. location Jack London Square has many restaurants game room with bowling the ferry is right there that can take you directly to a Giants game or to the city.

Excellent Customer Service. My wife I stayed for 4 nights. Room was spacious with all the amenities. 2 huge queen size beds microwave fridge safe and a beautiful view of the harbor. Customer service was exelent especially Ime at the front desk who was very friendly and accommodating with all our needs. Will definitely stay at the Waterfront Hotel again next time we are in the bay area.
Great views and super warm service. Room was spacious and room service was delicious.

Great Location in Jack London Square. This hotel is in an excellent location to do things in the Oakland area. There are a lot of good restaurants within easy walking distance. This hotel offers free wine and cheese to guests in the afternoon. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are clean.

The hotel and restaurant staff were friendly the room was ok at best. The noise level of the people upstairs our suite and the screeching lady next to us were annoying beyond imagination. Not much in the area nearby.

Great location. This hotel is in a great location at Jack London Square close to Amtrak and restaurants. The room was spacious and comfortable. The hallways could use some ventilation. Location and comfort. Many restaurants nearby. Fun to stroll long the boardwalk along the Oakland harbor. The nearby wholesale produce market is amazing to watch. Amtrak. Ventilation is needed in the hallways. Having to go outside to get to the elevator connecting to our room was a bit awkward.

Great location. Water view was very nice. Yoshi ’s for a celebratory dinner was amazing. Walls are pretty thin. Easy Uber ride from Oakland Airport. Main complaint is balcony screen door was ripped at handle looking like break in sliding door to balcony could be locked but extra security screw at bottom of door did not work and there was no way to secure the inner sliding door. Worried about security as a result.

Comfortable Clean and Spacious. The hotel was under renovation with no access to the main lobby area. The key cards were not always functional to get into the building from the side access where one was rerouted to enter the hotel. You hear trains all night long and get woken up at least 6 7 times per night. On the flip side you can literally walk to and from the train station to the hotel which was great. Jack London Square is now completely gentrified with police security that abounds so it is safe to night stroll around the hotel for dining and entertainment. Overall the rooms are clean spacious and comfortable and staff people are helpful and friendly.
Customer service was very nice. Nice rooms wirh a nice view.

My room was not clean when I got in there hair in the shower soap bar already opened empty water bottle on the floor. It was so late in the evening I did not feel like changing rooms. When I mentioned the issues to the front desk the next day the staff was apologetic but did not offer any remedy. Hopefully they will give feedback to the cleaning staff to do an inspection of the room before saying it is ready for future guests.
Had to move rooms twice due to air not working in room. Then the next room had construction on awnings just outside our window. banging on a Saturday.

best of Oakland on the water. The hotel is situated well with water views and adjacent to Jack London Square with its restaurant s The ferry to downtown is close and convenient. It is a long walk up town Oakland to the BART. past the myriad of homeless. Not a nice walk. Oakland is best from the train tracks to the water. The biggest complaint about the hotel is they paper thin walls. all noise s heard from above and next door. The doublet glazing moderated the train whistles to ok but the snoring from next room was full volume. We ended up dragging the mattress to the floor and well across the room to sleep.

I stayed in a 1King bed suite with a sea view from August 9 12 2019. It was something I wanted to visit for many years had to wait till I retired. The Waterfront Hotel is a seafaring themed hotel hesitate to say nautical themed. Each room or suite is quite large as large as a medium sized studio. I opted for the sea view which encompasses not only Jack London Square it ’s located in the middle of it just a few feet from the sculpture of the famous author but the ocean Alameda distant San Francisco. On Friday early evening to the weekends the sea view allows you to take in the three day festivities festooned with tents shops street food American Creole Soul dancers music the energy of people. The rooms are equipped with the standard fare but there is a nice dorm room sized refrigerator hidden in the cabinet beneath the large screen TV37 ” or larger. Next to it is your safe large enough for laptops other items. Below the safe is a 4dreser drawer ensemble. Two bottles of Kala Springs water is delivered daily. The bed is comfortable but I lounged watching TV on the large sofa as well. A circular dining table is positioned by the windows which can be opened enough to lean out taking in the nice sea breeze the aromas of a pizzeria just across the walkway the foods being prepared enjoyed outdoors from the hotel ’s Lungomare Restaurant Tuscan style Scott ’s Seafood Kincaid ’s Fish Chophouse restaurants the latter two walking distance. The room ’s bathroom is unique the bathtub shower is molded one piece with shelves a sturdy bar to hold onto. That part is built like the bunks from the seafaring days of the 170 180s. The shower head is adjustable from pinpoint to spray to both. There is a large desk with a curved back chair straddling four magazines introducing the guest to the sights sounds cuisines culture of Oakland. In room dining is from the Lungomare Restaurant a Tuscan cuisine of whose culinary dishes are lovingly handmade. I had a wonderful hand tossed pizza all pizzas are medium14 ”. accompanied by a prosciutto plate. If you ’re lucky to be in the east or Spinnaker Tower your elevators 2 drops you into a corridor leading to the restaurant. Note that the restaurant is packed reservations are recommended. Sunday Brunch encompasses the usual culinary fare. I had a Bolognese pasta with veal pork beef accompanied by nicely marinated vegetables. Dessert is either a Budino gelato or sorbet. There ’s an extensive wine list a selection of beers. The staff is knowledgeable especially for allergies they try to accommodate everyone. I gave it 4stars only because 15blocks away a rail line shared by Amtrak Caltrain freight shares rumbles around. This is a must visit hotel where the professional knowledgeable staff will accommodate you. It ’s part of the Joie de Vivre chain which is now part of the Hyat portfolio group of hotels.

Pleasant. Location. The shower curtain stunk like old mildew. Shower curtains are cheap and should be changed regularly. The afternoon wine and cheese thing has gone downhill. People were editing and it was n’t set until 515 not to mention the quality of the wine.
Love the onsite restaurant although they no longer serve lunch. LocationI thought we booked a room with a view got a view of the parking lot. Asked to be moved and they accommodated us.

Arrived at 1 pm and thought we had try to check in. We were told our room was ready and they had be happy to check us in early for a fee of 75. Yes a pure money grab. So we left to get some drinks somewhere else. Hotel Management we would have tried the bar at the hotel but you left us with a bad taste in our mouth. so we went elsewhere. We checked in at 3 pm. Found out we had also have resort and parking fees. Stay was OK. Bed was very hard shower had quite a bit of mold mildew looked like someone had just tried to caulk over the problem and it was not working so well. Went to check out the next day and wanted to get some breakfast a short walk away. Seems checkout is 11 am. so inquired if it would be OK if we checked out potentially 30 minutes late and was told that would be a 100 fee. So if you like to have to pay ridiculous amounts for what most hotels will do for a smile I suggest the Waterfront Hotel. they have a true Joie de Vivre which I now understand is French for joy of trying to alleviate you of cash.

Pleasant stay horrible check in. The stay was enjoyable it was the check in we had an issue with. Upon check in they gave us a two queen bed ADA room and when I came back to the front to tell them they gave me the wrong room they told me that ’s what I reserved. I showed them my reservation and they still insisted it was wrong. They said they did n’t have any other rooms to give us and continued to blame hotelscom for the mixup. I informed them I have never had an issue with hotelscom and after a grueling 20 min back and forth all of a sudden they had the room we reserved available. I do n’t understand how this is and why it was such an ordeal giving us the room we reserved.

The location is fantastic. The Waterfront is situated in Oaklands historic Jack London Square. There are many restaurants and night life to enjoy. It was easy to hop the ferry to San Francisco and meet family that traveled in by Amtrak. The rooms were nice and clean. The balcony overlooked the Oakland Estuary and a view of San Francisco. The bathrooms were a bit small though. Valet was the only and safe parking. It is very expensive. We will definitely return to the Waterfront Hotel.

Exceptional. I liked when I called front desk to ask if valet was going to be charged on my card. because I had lost it. The girl at the front desk said not to worry about it that she wo nt charged me valet. That made my day. I did nt like the balcony setting up on second floor. they should remodel that. Not a good look.
